title: 109_s2627
content: The Act is titled the "National Park System Advisory Board Reauthorization Act of 2006" and it amends Section 3 of the Act of August 21, 1935 to establish the National Park System Advisory Board. The National Park System Advisory Board Reauthorization Act of 2006 establishes the National Park System Advisory Board with up to 12 members appointed from U.S. citizens committed to the cause. The National Park System Advisory Board consists of up to 12 members appointed from U.S. citizens with expertise in various fields such as history, archeology, ecology, and natural resource management. The National Park System Advisory Board consists of up to 12 members with expertise in various fields such as history, archeology, ecology, and natural resource management. Additionally, 3 members must have expertise in disciplines like financial management, travel and tourism management, recreational use management, concessions management, and land use planning or business management. One member should have expertise in historic recreational opportunities within National Park System units, and another member must be a locally elected official from an area adjacent to or within close proximity to a park unit. The National Park System Advisory Board appoints members to represent various geographic regions and adopts procedures for meetings and vacancies. The Board may adopt procedures related to compensation, travel expenses, and duties of its members. In subsection (b), the Advisory Board Staff is redefined and paragraph (2) is removed. Additionally, in subsection (f), the year is updated from 2007 to 2016. SEC. 3. TECHNICAL AMENDMENTS. The Act of August 21, 1935 is amended in section 3(c)(1)(D) and the first subsection of section 4.
